FuncDef:
The flowspec match vxlan-packet enable command enables BGP Flowspec for packets that have entered the IPv4 VXLAN tunnel.
The undo flowspec match vxlan-packet enable command disables BGP Flowspec for packets that have entered the IPv4 VXLAN tunnel.
By default, BGP Flowspec is disabled for packets that have entered the IPv4 VXLAN tunnel.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When BGP Flowspec needs to be performed on a IPv4 VXLAN tunnel ingress, run the flowspec match vxlan-packet enable command to enable the BGP Flowspec function for packets that have entered the IPv4 VXLAN tunnel. If BGP Flowspec is not required for packets that have entered the IPv4 VXLAN tunnel, run the undo flowspec match vxlan-packet enable command.
Precautions
This command is not applicable to the LPUF-50/LPUF-50-L/LPUI-21-L/LPUI-51-L/LPUF-51/LPUF-51-B/LPUI-51/LPUI-51-B/LPUS-51/LPUF-101/LPUF-101-B/LPUI-101/LPUI-101-B/LPUS-101.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
